page.title: 07Kidderminster, The Canal
page.content: The{Stafforshire and Worcestershire {Canal}was built between 1766 and l772 under the direction of James Brindley and joined the rivers Trent and Severn, creating a new town at{ {Stourport. The canal was built at a cost of about Â£100,000 and had 47 locks in its 52 miles. The Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal Company seems to have been well managed, the initial purchasers of shares at Â£100 were able to sell them at up to Â£400. Barges carried a multitude of items but coal, iron-ware, glass, pottery, textiles and agricultural products accounted for the majority.
